Legal_Issue: Procedural fairness in refugee claim determination due to translation issues
Application_Facts: Applicant faced poor translation during hearing, leading to misrepresentation of key details affecting credibility assessment
Decision_Outcome: Original decision overturned and referred back for rehearing
Court_Ruling: Judicial review granted; original decision set aside; new hearing ordered with different decision-maker
Defendant_Behavior: Failure to ensure accurate translation during refugee hearing
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness due to inadequate interpretation
Assessment_Factor: Impact of translation errors on credibility and ability to present case
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate translation during refugee status determination hearing
Evidence_Used: Record of hearing, evidence of translation errors, applicant's testimony
Application_Basis: Procedural fairness and right to fair hearing
Evidence_Assessed: Discrepancies in interpreted statements versus actual testimony
Relief_Sought: Overturning of decision and order for a new hearing
Governing_Rule: Procedural fairness under administrative law and statutory framework
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Poor quality translation leading to inaccurate record
Outcome: Judicial review successful; decision set aside; new hearing ordered
Harm_Assessment: Applicant unable to effectively present claim due to language barrier
Cause_Description: Poor quality of translation affected the applicant's ability to present his case effectively
Evidence_Handling: Translation errors led to misinterpretation of key facts in the applicant's testimony
Legal_Provision_Violated: Procedural fairness obligations under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Issues: Significant discrepancies in interpretation affecting material aspects of the claim
Misrepresentation_Element: Inadvertent misrepresentation due to faulty translation
Evidence_Assessment: Translation inaccuracies undermined reliability of evidence considered
Decision_Rationale: Procedural unfairness compromised the integrity of the decision-making process
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient accuracy in interpretation services provided during hearing
